Description.val:
The FY 2016 funding request was reduced by $1.661 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

This budget provides funding for the in service LPD 17 class program support equipment. Previous funding for LPD 17 class support equipment (FY12 and earlier) was provided under line item OPN 0981, Items Less Than $5 Million. Funding is required to upgrade mission critical electronic and HM&E systems including the Engineering Control Systems (ECS), Ship Control Systems (SCS), Degaussing Systems, Shipboard Wide-Area Network (SWAN), commercial software products for ECS, SCS, C4ISR and Administrative Communications.

CJ2IN - Installation of Equipment
Funding is for installation of equipment in support of the Fleet Modernization Program (FMP).

[P40A / CJ010 - Schoolhouse TTE]: CJ010 - SCHOOLHOUSE TTE											
Funding for Schoolhouse Technical Training Equipment (TTE) is for the infrastructure and equipment to set up the schoolhouses for multiple systems such as ECS and SCS 60Hz and Ship Service Diesel Generators (SSDG).  The schoolhouses will provide critical training to sailors in operation and maintenance of those systems.

[P40A / CJ020 - Shore Based Spares]: CJ020 SHORE BASED SPARES									
Shore-Based Spares funding is required for procurement of Shore-Based Spares in support of the LPD 17 class deployed assets.  Shore-Based Spares are critical long lead time items that will be staged shoreside in case of catastrophic failure.

[P3A / CJ030 - HW/SW Obsolescence]: CJ030 LPD 17 HW/SW OBSOLESCENCE										
HW/SW Obsolescence effort addresses hardware obsolescence/technology refreshment issues, and class upgrades focused on increased capabilities, force protection, and safety.  Funding will support procurement of hardware and software changes to the systems listed:		
- Command Information Display System (CIDS) 23TV, Replace projectors with LED Projectors
- Engineering Control Systems (ECS) - Windows XP upgrade
- Ship Control Systems (SCS) - Windows XP upgrade/SCS Tech Refresh, Digital Rudder Angle Display Information System (DRADIS)  
- Magnetic Signature Control System (MSCS) - Windows XP upgrade, DCA Redesign.
- HM&E Network - HM&E Network Upgrades
- Wire-free Portable Communication System (WPCS) - Uninterrupted Power Supply (UPS) Upgrade, Low Power Amplifier Upgrade, Main Site Upgrade.	
- 27TV - 27TV System Upgrade
- Advanced Fire and Smoke Sensor System (AFSS) - AFSS System Upgrade. 
- Integrated Voice Communication System (IVCS) - IVCS system upgrades (local cutout switches, AFT lookout comm mod, obsolete terminal replacement, FWD/AFT KITE), Software version 7.2.2
- 1MC Announcing System - Digital Microphone Control Station
- Navigational Data Distribution System (NDDS)

[P3A - 2 / CJ040 HM&E Electrical Modifications]: CJ040 HM&E ELECTRICAL MODIFICATIONS									
HME Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on electrical systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. HM&E Electrical Modifications include:
SWAN UPS- Space Based UPS Reduction

[P3A - 3 / CJ050 - HM&E Survivability Modifications]: CJ050 HM&E SURVIVABILITY MODIFICATIONS								
HME Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on HM&E systems (impacting ship survivability) and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. HM&E Survivability Modifications include: Damage Control Action Management System (DCAMS) 1.1 upgrade, Smoke Ejection System (SES) Redesign, Night Vision Device (NVD) Well Deck Upgrades, Composite Ventilation Louvers and Screens.

[P3A - 4 / CJ060 - HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Modifications]: CJ060 HM&E MECHANICAL/AUXILIARY MODIFICATIONS									
HME Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on mechanical and auxiliary systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. HM&E Mechanical/ Auxiliary Modifications include:
MIDE Bulkhead Shaft Seal, Helo Hangar Door Control Modifications, VCHT Ejector Pump PLC Upgrade, 2nd Pass Reverse Osmosis (RO) Unit Upgrade, RO Unit Potable Water EDG Recirculation Capability, Aviation Maintenance Bridge Crane Replacement, Knuckleboom Crane Improvements, Geislinger Coupling Improvements, Scullery Improvements and Gaylord System Improvements.

[P3A - 5 / CJ070 SWAN-CANES Integration]: CJ070 SWAN-CANES Integration
The results of the Shipboard Wide Area Network (SWAN) / Consolidated Afloat Networks and Enterprise Services (CANES) study directed the replacement of the C4I capability of the LPD 17 Class SWAN with CANES and the conversion of the non-C4I SWAN into a new HM&E Network.  SWAN funding is required to field the new HM&E Network in support of the CANES installation.  SWAN funding is also required to sustain the legacy SWAN, until its replacement, to address SWAN obsolescence, reliability issues, performance concerns, and emergent Fleet requirements including enabling Cryptologic Log On (CLO), eradicating Windows XP, replacing aging obsolete network hardware (e.g., servers and core switches), and maintaining the Information Assurance posture of the Common Operating Environment (COE).  SWAN sustainment modifications will be conducted in parallel with HM&E Network conversion and will be phased out as CANES installations begin.

Name.@footnote: HW/SW Obsolescence (CJ030) includes funding for procurement and installation of equipment to correct obsolescence issues on (11) mission critical systems. Fielding plan varies by hull configuration and includes up to (17) alterations of varying scope, cost and hull applicability. In each FY, PMS 470 is procuring for and executing a different number of LPD 17 Class CNO availabilities. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. Because of this, unit costs vary between FYs.  Significant changes since PB 15 budget due to LPD 17 Class availability shifts between fiscal years due to ship's operational schedule. FY14 procurement funds (2) shipsets of equipment for install during (2) FY15 availabilities on LPD 20 and LPD 22. FY15 procurement funds (3) shipsets of equipment for install during (3) FY16 availabilities on LPD 21, LPD 23 and LPD 24. FY16 procurement funds (6) shipsets of equipment for install during (6) FY17 availabilities on LPD 17, LPD 18, LPD 19, LPD 20, LPD 22 and LPD 25. Average unit cost of these procurements varies due to scope of the specific alterations which make up each shipset package, which is determined by individual hull configurations and length/ type of CNO availability that the install will take place during.

- Command Information Display System (CIDS) 23TV - Replace projectors with LED Projectors
- Engineering Control Systems (ECS) - Windows XP upgrade
- Ship Control Systems (SCS) - Windows XP upgrade/SCS Tech Refresh, Digital Rudder Angle Display Information System (DRADIS) 
- Magnetic Signature Control System (MSCS) - Windows XP upgrade
- Wire-free Portable Communication System (WPCS) - Uniterupted Power Supply (UPS) Upgrade, Low Power Amplifier Upgrade
- 27TV - 27TV System Upgrade
- Advanced Fire and Smoke Sensor System (AFSS) - AFSS System Upgrade 
- Integrated Voice Communication System (IVCS)- IVCS system upgrades (local cutout switches, AFT lookout comm mod, obsolete terminal replacement, FWD/AFT KITE), Software version 7.2.2.
- 1MC Announcing System - Digital Microphone Control Station1MC improvements
- Navigational Data Distribution System (NDDS)

Name.@footnote: HM&E Mod package fluctuates from year to year according to the LPD avail schedule; cost estimates dependent on the ship configuration for the avails during specific years and the magnitude of modification required during the availability.   HM&E Mod (Electrical, Survivability, Mechanical/ Auxiliary): Procurement and install of equipment for (17) different mission critical systems, and (19) different alterations (each with varying scope and hull applicability based on ship configurations on 11 ships).  FY16 Procurements support the Installations on the LPD 17 (FY17 Dry-Docking Phased Maintenance Availability, DPMA), LPD 18 (FY17 Dry-Docking Selected Restricted Availability, DSRA), and LPD 19 (FY17 DPMA)

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: HM&E Survivability Modifications

Description.val:
[HM&E Survivability Modifications] HME Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability, issues on HM&E systems (impacting ship survivability) and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. HM&E Survivability Modifications include:
Halocarbon Monitor Upgrade, Damage Control Action Management System (DCAMS) 1.1 upgrade, Smoke Ejection System (SES) Redesign, Night Vision Device (NVD) Well Deck Upgrades, Composite Ventilation Louvers and Screens.

Name.@footnote: Significant changes since PB15 budget due to the shift of USS SAN ANTONIO Dry-docking Phased Maintenance Availability (DPMA) shift from FY16 to FY17.  Based on FY14 Type Commander (TYCOM) request, PMS 470 has revised the fielding plan for Auxiliary Seawater (ASW)/ Firemain (FM) modifications. These major modifications include system chlorinator installations, replacement of bronze valves with titanium valves and modification of system branch piping. Due to severity of system biological fouling, Fleet and Program Office emphasis was to install chlorinators at the earliest possible availability on each ship (LPD 17-22). To expedite the chlorinator installations, the remaining valve replacement and branch piping modifications will have to be executed in additional phases during each ships following availabilities.  HM&E Mod package fluctuates from year to year according to the LPD Avail schedule; cost estimates dependent on the ship configuration for the avails during specific years and the magnitude of modification required during the availability.   HM&E Mod (Electrical, Survivability, Mechanical/ Auxiliary): Procurement and install of equipment for (17) different mission critical systems, and (19) different alterations (each with varying scope and hull applicability based on ship configurations on 11 ships).  Unit costs vary between FYs because the HM&E Mechanical/ Auxiliary line is comprised of multiple different ship alterations, each with varying scope and hull applicability. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in complexity and cost based on individual ship configurations. Alteration installation schedule is dictated by the CNO availability schedule, and the number of CNO availabilities for LPD 17 class ships fluctuates greatly per FY (3-6 availabilities per FY). The above variables drive fluctuation in average unit cost between FYs in the exhibits.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Modifications

Description.val:
[HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Modifications] HME Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability, issues on mechanical and auxiliary systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns.  HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Modifications include:
Mide Bulkhead Shaft Seal, Helo Hangar Door Control Modifications, VCHT Ejector Pump PLC Upgrade, 2nd Pass Reverse Osmosis (RO) Unit Upgrade, RO Unit Potable Water EDG Recirculation Capability, Aviation Maintenance Bridge Crane Replacement, Knuckleboom Crane Improvements, Geislinger Coupling Improvements, Scullery Improvements and Gaylord System Improvements.  

Funding for system design and development to include Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) and First Article Procurement and Testing required two year prior to first install.

Name.@footnote: The PB15 Exhibit "Qty (Each)" represents the number of ship availabilities in the specific FY.  The "Qty (Each)" for PB16 was more correctly noted as the total number of upgrades performed in the FY; multiple upgrades occur in any specific availability depending on Shipboard Wide Area Network (SWAN) configuration for each hull.

FY15 Availabilities:  LPD 19 - SWAN Server (Dell)/COMPOSE 3.0; SWAN Server Compose 4.0; Network Storage Device (NSD); SWAN Transport/Adaptation Software; Acatel Operating System Upgrade; and SIPRNET CLO. LPD 25 - SWAN Transport/Adaptation Software; and SIPRNET CLO. LPD 22 - SWAN Transport/Adaptation Software; and SIPRNET CLO. LPD 20 - SWAN Server Compose 4.0; Network Storage Device (NSD); SWAN Transport/Adaptation Software; Acatel Operating System Upgrade; and SIPRNET CLO.  FY16 Availabilities: LPD 21 -SWAN Server (Dell)/COMPOSE 3.0; SWAN Server Compose 4.0; Network Router; Network Storage Device (NSD); SWAN Transport/Adaptation Software; Acatel Operating System Upgrade; and SIPRNET CLO." LPD 23 - SWAN Mesh CORE Switch; SWAN Server Compose 4.0; ; Network Router; Network Storage Device (NSD); SWAN Transport/Adaptation Software; and SIPRNET CLO. LPD 24 - SWAN Mesh CORE Switch; Network Router; SWAN Transport/Adaptation Software; Acatel Operating System Upgrade; and SIPRNET CLO.

Description.val: [SWAN-CANES Integration] The results of the Shipboard Wide Area Network (SWAN) / Consolidated Afloat Networks and Enterprise Services (CANES) study directed the replacement of the C4I capability of the LPD 17 Class SWAN with CANES and the conversion of the non-C4I SWAN into a new HM&E Network.  SWAN funding is required to field the new HM&E Network in support of the CANES installation.  SWAN funding is also required to sustain the legacy SWAN, until its replacement, to address SWAN obsolescence, reliability issues, performance concerns, and emergent Fleet requirements including enabling Cryptologic Log On (CLO), eradicating Windows XP, replacing aging obsolete network hardware (e.g., servers and core switches), and maintaining the Information Assurance posture of the Common Operating Environment (COE).  SWAN sustainment modifications will be conducted in parallel with HM&E Network conversion and will be phased out as CANES installations begin.
